In this study, mesenchymal stem cells derived from human embryonic stem cells(hE-MSCs) that secrete hepatocyte growth factor (HGF) were used to observe the repair ofthioacetamide (TAA)-induced liver fibrosis. Our results showed that TIF1γ was significantlydecreased in LX2 cells when exposed to TGFβ1. Such decrease of TIF1γ was significantlyprevented by co-culture with hE-MSCs. Interaction of TIF1γ with SMAD2/3 and binding to thepromoter of the α-smooth muscle gene (αSMA) suppressed αSMA expression. Phosphorylationof cAMP response element-binding protein (CREB) and binding on the TIF1γ promoter regioninduced TIF1γ expression. Furthermore, hepatic stellate cell-specific TIF1γ-knockout mice showedaggravation of liver fibrosis.In conclusion, loss of TIF1γ aggravates fibrosis, suggesting that a strategy to maintain TIF1γ duringliver injury would be a promising therapeutic approach to prevent or reverse liver fibrosis.

On top of industry players’ on-going effortsto drive their own R&D, it is not uncommon for us to witness the evolving trend of Open Innovationin the industry. As it is critical for any industry player to launch a new product with differentiatedvalues, there are increasing needs to collaborate with external partners for innovation. In this study,we examine the major strategies of Open Innovation for Medical Technology companies to furtheraccelerate their sustainable growth in the industry. The result is that out of nearly $160billion spent annually on biomedical research up to 85% of this funded research is estimated to beinefficient. The main reason for this waste is “ finding the right answers for the wrong questions”:research findings that have little or no relevance for the communities who are meant to benefit.All of that suggests that most ‘impact investing’ funds out there aren’t great, but it also suggestssome circumstances where it is a good idea. In particular, I would like to point out that in inefficientmarkets with fewer investors and with imperfect information, unlike the stock market, access toinvestment is a much bigger deal.Impact investors can choose from an array of sectors and causes. Yet the Global Impact InvestingNetwork reports that just 5 percent of impact investments were dedicated to health care in 2018,well behind other areas like energy, microfinance, and housing. This may be due to a misguidedbelief that investments in life sciences are higher risk or require higher capital. Adjusting theseassumptions with sage investment advice could boost health care impact investments and providethe funding needed for better treatments and cures. The crowd funding 2.0 social innovationscheme proposed is semistructured to bring both citizens and angel investors while ample spacefor the citizen and community participation at the upstream design and funding stage. Unlike thetraditional public-private funding stream, crowd funding 2.0 has the potential to truly empowercitizens and achieve extended peer review for creative leaps that directly benefit user communities.063

Recent advances in DNA sequencing methodology reveal that somaticmutations are remarkably prevalent, indicating a degree of cell-to-cell heterogeneity that waspreviously unappreciated. When somatic mutations occur in “driver” genes, these cells can undergoa clonal expansion in physiologically normal tissues and cell populations. This process has beenextensively studied in the hematopoietic system, and it is referred to as “clonal hematopoiesis”.Depending on how it is defined and measured, robust levels of clonal hematopoiesis range frommore than 10% in individuals past the age of 70 to more than 50% in individuals past the ageof 85. Epidemiological studies indicate that clonal hematopoiesis is associated with increasedmortality due in large part to an increase in cardiovascular disease risk. Our work supports theconcept that clonal hematopoiesis is a causal risk factor for cardiovascular disease, and we havedefined aspects of this new disease mechanism. This work has shown that expanding mutantclones, attributed to mutations in TET2, DNMT3A, JAK2V617F and other driver genes, increasinglygive rise to progeny leukocytes with altered phenotypic properties. While different mutant drivergenes confer distinct phenotypes to their progeny leukocytes within the clone, a growing bodyof experimental evidence suggests that activation of IL-1b and/or IL-6 expression represent acommon mechanistic feature shared by multiple forms of clonal hematopoiesis. Overall, thesefindings support the concept that clonal hematopoiesis represents a new mechanism of age-relateddisease development that shares features with hematologic malignancy. Further research in thearea could provide a mechanistic framework for personalized anti-inflammatory therapies to treatindividuals who carry specific somatic mutation clones within their hematopoietic cell populations.

The regenerative medicine of the failing heart had been longawaited. To address this question, we had induced human iPS cell-derived ventricular specificcardiomyocytes using HLA haplotype homo iPS cells developed by Shinya Yamanaka’s group,which can be transplanted into 16% of the whole Japanese population without serious immunerejection. We performed transcriptome of the metabolic enzymes and fluxome analysis using13glucose and 13lactic acid on iPS cells and cardiomyocytes, and found that their metabolicpathways were completely different. Based on these findings, we purified cardiomyocytes usingglucose-free lactate-supplemented medium. Purity of the cardiomyocytes was >99%, and they didnot make teratoma formation. The transplanted cardiomyocytes using our technique survived in theheart for the long time, and showed physiological growth after transplantation. Transplantation ofiPS-derived cardiomyocytes into the infarcted myocardium could improve cardiac function in rat,porcine and monkey model. We expect the combination of these techniques can achieve futureheart regeneration. We are now preparing the first in human clinical research to the patients withdilated cardiomyopathy in the near future.

There have been several reportsregarding the bi-directional association between COVID-19 and cardiovascular disease. Patientswith various cardiovascular conditions such as hypertension, diabetes, heart failure, and coronaryartery disease are at increased risk of poor prognosis, death, and experiencing a severe form ofthe disease including severe acute respiratory failure. Further, the virus that causes COVID-19,the SARS coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) target endothelial cells leading to increased permeability,potentiation of inflammation, and cytokine storm. The virus mechanism of entry may be throughbinding of the viral spike protein to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 on the surface of thehost cell. The fact that many patients with cardiovascular disease take drugs that may affect thisenzyme may complicate treatment even further. In addition, COVID-19 may result in not only directmyocardial injury but also the activation of the coagulation cascade which may lead to thrombosisand subsequent bleeding when the activation of one’s internal countermeasures result in the viciouscycle of disseminated intravascular coagulation. We will need to understand the interplay betweenthe virus, the clinical syndrome that it causes, and the cardiovascular system to better manage thepatients infected with the SARS-CoV-2.067

Prominentexamples are the expert systems of 1970s and 1980s in which doctor’s knowledge wasprogrammed into AI to assist medical diagnosis. Recently, deep learning-based AI has emergedas a new technology for biomedical research. In contrast to the rule-based expert systems whererules were made manually by humans, deep learning is data-driven, i.e. the knowledge acquisitionprocess is automated by machine learning from raw data, instead of by humans. Since the AIsystem’s performance can be improved as more data are accumulated, AI may reach a singularitywhere its performance can excel human performance. This talk gives an overview of modern AItechnology, discusses its impact on biomedical research, and provides insights into the right wayof using AI technology for biomedicine

In physiological conditions, its main general functions areremoval of interstitial fluid, formed by blood capillary filtrates, and tissue immunosurveillance.Lately, special functions and regulations of specialized lymphatic vessels are lately discovered. Inthis seminar, I will talk about novel roles of meningeal lymphatic vessels (mLVs). Lately, glymphaticsystem is proposed as one of main routes for cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) drainage but its end routeis not known. Moreover, mLVs are re-discovered but their precise location of the mLVs responsiblefor CSF uptake and the exact route of CSF drainage into the cervical lymph nodes are unknown.Here, we uncovered the mLVs in the basal part of the skull (basal mLVs) by visualizing theirdistinct anatomic location and characterizing their specialized morphologic features that facilitateCSF uptake and drainage. Unlike dorsal mLVs, basal mLVs had a bunch of lymphatic capillarieswith valves that were located adjacent to the subarachnoid space. We further demonstrate thatthe basal mLVs are hotspots for CSF macromolecule clearance and that their integrity and CSFdrainage are impaired with ageing. Our findings present basal mLVs as a long-held undiscoveredroute taken by CSF macromolecules to exit the central nervous system and hold promise for betterunderstanding on pathogenesis of neurodegenerative diseases including Alzheimer disease.069

Keynote 발표자였던 Verve Therapeutics의 공동 창립자이자 CEO인 Sekar Kathiresan 박사는 심장마비(heart attack) 환자에서 7가지 위험 유전자 변이(mutation)에 대한 정확한 인과관계를 규명하였다. 나아가 영장류(non-human primates) 모델을이용하여 위험 인자 가운데 “PCSK9”과 “ANGPTL3” 유전자에 대한 편집기술(gene editing)을 시행하였고, 각각 LDL 콜레스테롤 수치의 59% 감소와 트리글리세리드(triglyceride) 64% 감소를 확인하

Mummery 교수가 차기 회장으로 선출된 2021년의 ISSCR 학회는 독일함부르크에서 개최 예정이며, 전세계적인 코로나19 대유행이 백신 및 치료제 개발로 현지에서 정상적으로 개최되기를 희망해본다.083
